Krishnan: New online gaming rules bring clarity, authority to be operational from day oneThe draft online gaming rules aim to bring clarity for industry players while safeguarding users, MeitY Secretary S. Krishnan said. Registration is mandatory for e-sports but voluntary for social games, with banks allowed to return user funds. He added that the new Online Gaming Authority will be active from day one, while the ECM scheme has drawn overwhelming industry response.The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) has released draft rules for online gaming, aimed at bringing regulatory clarity while supporting innovation in the sector. In an exclusive interview with CNBC-TV18, MeitY Secretary S. Krishnan explained key provisions, stressing that the framework is designed to safeguard users while enabling ease of doing business for developers.On the release of the draft online gaming rules
Krishnan dismissed the idea of a staggered rollout, noting that the legislation was passed swiftly in Parliament and the rules were framed after extensive consultation with industry.
“Most of the industry has accepted the spirit of the law and stopped offering many of the money games defined under it. The rules are fairly straightforward, and we want to give the industry enough time to respond,” he said.
On registration requirements
He clarified that registration is not mandatory for online social games.
“Registration of an online social game is voluntary. This is a major ease of doing business step for startups and innovators, ensuring that small or educational games don’t face regulatory burden,” Krishnan added. By contrast, e-sports will require registration under the new framework.
On enabling banks to return user deposits
Addressing industry concerns on refunds, Krishnan said the Act was not designed to penalise players.
“The intent is to treat them more as victims. That’s why clarity has been provided to banks that they can return deposits or money collected without violating the law,” he noted.
On subscription vs reward models
While subscription-based revenue is permissible, reward-based models will require closer scrutiny.
“The subscription system is clearly covered in the Act. Reward systems will have to be examined, case by case, by the authority, depending on their nature,” he said.
On Online Gaming Authority
Krishnan emphasised that the proposed authority will be ready to function immediately.
“We’ve kept it lean and digital so it can be operational from day one of the rules being notified. Officials are in place, and the system will be ready to launch quickly,” he said.
On the Component Scheme response
The Secretary also highlighted the overwhelming industry response to the Electronics Component Manufacturing (ECM) scheme, with proposals worth ₹1.15 lakh crore—double the government’s initial expectations. However, he cautioned that there was no fixed timeline for approvals.
“We don’t want to rush the technical teams. The priority is ensuring quality implementation,” Krishnan stressed.
On technology transfer under the Component Scheme
He underlined that foreign companies applying under joint ventures would be expected to transfer technology to Indian entities.
“This is embedded in the scheme’s spirit. We’re moving step by step—from assembly to local manufacturing and then to design. India has one of the best STEM talent pools in the world, and that makes it a natural design hub,” he said.(Edited by : Ajay Vaishnav)

title: MeitY Secretary: DPDP rules finalised, awaiting legal vetting
content:
MeitY Secretary S. Krishnan confirmed the Digital Personal Data Protection (DPDP) rules are finalised and awaiting legal vetting, with notification expected soon after clearance.The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) has completed work on the Digital Personal Data Protection (DPDP) Rules and sent them for legal vetting, according to Secretary S. Krishnan.

"We met the minister’s deadline of September 28. The rules are ready at our end, but they are now with the legal authorities for vetting. It would not be fair to hustle them, but we are hopeful of an early clearance. If it comes even over a weekend, we will notify immediately," Krishnan said.

The DPDP Rules, which follow the passage of the Digital Personal Data Protection Act earlier this year, will operationalise the new law governing the collection, processing, and protection of personal data in India. Once notified, the framework is expected to reshape compliance requirements for businesses and strengthen the rights of individuals in the digital ecosystem.

title: Health Ministry reacts to quality woes related to cough syrup in Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan
content:
HomeIndia NewsHealthcare NewsHealth Ministry reacts to quality woes related to cough syrup in Madhya Pradesh, RajasthanThe Union Health Ministry ruled out contamination of cough syrups due to chemicals such as Diethylene Glycol (DEG) or Ethylene Glycol (EG), after Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh reported deaths of children due to alleged consumption of such syrups.The Union Health Ministry issued a statement on Friday, October 3, on the reported deaths of children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan due to alleged consumption of tainted cough syrups, and ruled out contamination due to chemicals such as Diethylene Glycol (DEG) or Ethylene Glycol (EG).

Reacting to the quality concerns related to cough syrup in Madhya Pradesh, health ministry said that a joint team consisting of representatives from National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC), National Institute of Virology (NIV), Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO), and others, visited the site in the state.

"Various samples were collected in coordination with the state authorities including samples of various cough syrups. As per the test results, none of the samples contained Diethylene Glycol (DEG) or Ethylene Glycol (EG), contaminants that are known to cause serious kidney injury," read the statement issued by the union health ministry.

It added that the Madhya Pradesh State Food and Drug Administration (SFDA) tested three samples and confirmed the absence of DEG/EG.

When it comes to tests undertaken, the central government clarified that the blood/CSF samples have been tested by NIV Pune for common pathogens and one case was found positive for Leptospirosis.

In MP’s Chhindwara district, at least six children lost their lives and about 20-25 are still sick and under medical examination, due to the alleged consumption of such cough syrups.

Read more: Cough syrup killing kids: Probe committees formed as toll rises in Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan

"Samples of water, entomological vectors, and respiratory specimens are under further investigation by NEERI, NIV Pune, and other laboratories. Multi-disciplinary team comprising experts from NCDC, NIV, ICMR, AIIMS Nagpur, and state health authorities is investigating all possible causes behind the reported cases," the union health ministry said.

Deaths due to cough syrups in Rajasthan

In the case of reported deaths of children in Rajasthan, the Union Health Ministry clarified that the product in question does not contain Propylene Glycol, which can be "potential source of contaminants, DEG/EG."

"Product under reference is a dextromethorphan-based formulation, which is not recommended for paediatric use," the statement said.

The Director General of Health Services (DGHS) in Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare further took cognisance of popular use of cough syrups and issued an advisory to all States and Union Territories on rational use of cough syrups in the paediatric population.

It also called for sensitising the people and medical practitioners to ensure rational drug use.

"The cough syrups and cold medications should not be prescribed or dispensed to children under 2 years. These are generally not recommended for ages below 5 years," said the advisory issued to all states and union territories.

It further stated that for ages above 5 years, "any use should follow careful clinical evaluation with close supervision and strict adherence to appropriate dosing, the shortest effective duration and avoiding multiple drug combinations."

“Non-pharmacological measures, including adequate hydration, rest, supportive measures should be first line of approach,” the advisory noted.

The actual reason behind the deaths in Rajasthan and MP is yet to be identified, and it would be crucial to see how the government protects the population from such cases and deaths in the future.

title: Pakistan's oppressive approach and illegal occupation of PoK reason for protests, says MEA
content:
HomeIndia NewsIndia says protests in PoK natural consequence of Pakistan's oppressive approach and illegal occupationIndia says protests in PoK natural consequence of Pakistan's oppressive approach and illegal occupationMEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal also confirmed India's position on the territories of Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh by stating that these regions are an "integral part of India" and will remain the same way forever.India's Ministry of External Affairs on Friday, October 3, said that protests in several areas of Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) are a "natural" consequence of Pakistan's oppressive approach in these territories.

"We have seen reports on protests in several areas of Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir, including brutalities by Pakistani forces on innocent civilians," Randhir Jaiswal, Official Spokesperson of the MEA said at a press briefing in New Delhi.

"We believe that it is a natural consequence of Pakistan’s oppressive approach and systemic plundering of resources from these territories, which remain under its forcible and illegal occupation," he added.

The official further called for holding Pakistan accountable for the human rights violations happening on its soil.

"Pakistan must be held accountable for its horrific human rights violations," Jaiswal said.

The MEA spokesperson also confirmed India's position on the territories of Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh by stating that these regions are an "integral part of India" and will remain the same way forever.

#WATCH | Delhi | MEA Official Spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal says, "We have seen reports on protests in several areas of Pakistan-occupied Jammu & Kashmir, including brutalities by Pakistani forces on innocent civilians. We believe that it is a natural consequence of Pakistan’s… pic.twitter.com/KGrMfVrwE3
— ANI (@ANI) October 3, 2025


The ongoing unrest in PoK 

The remarks come when the PoK region is witnessing one of the largest waves of protest in recent years. Thousands of locals across regions such as Muzaffarabad, Mirpur, Rawalkot, Neelum Valley, and Kotly staged protests after discussions between Pakistani authorities and the Awami Action Committee (AAC), which is a coalition of civil groups, lawyers, and traders, did not result into an agreement.

"Our campaign is not against any institution but for the fundamental rights denied to our people for over 70 years. Enough is enough," AAC leader Shaukat Nawaz Mir said, as per News18.

The Pakistani forces opened fire and resorted to military crackdown on the protestors, leading to several deaths and leaving dozens of demonstrators injured, as per local reports.

Daily life in the region remains severely affected as markets stay closed, and public transport is hit. Security in the region has been increased heavily and detentions are being done on a widespread level.

The protestors demand tax cuts for traders, better education institutions and facilities, job opportunities for the local youth, along with fair farming policies among others.(Edited by : Prashanth Perumal)

title: NHAI to put QR codes on highways for project details and emergency helpline
content:
HomeIndia NewsNHAI to put QR codes on highways for project details and emergency helplineNHAI will soon install QR code signboards on National Highways to share project details, emergency contacts, and helpline 1033, aiming to boost road safety and improve commuter experience.

State-owned NHAI on Friday said it will install project information signboards with quick response (QR) codes along the National Highway stretches to provide relevant information and emergency helpline numbers to commuters.

The vertical QR Code Sign Boards will provide project-specific information, including national highway number, highway chainage, contact numbers for highway patrol, toll manager, resident engineer, and emergency helpline 1033, NHAI said in a statement.

These signboards will be placed near wayside amenities, rest areas, toll plazas, truck lay-byes, highway start/end points, and signage.

The QR code signboards will not only help to enhance road safety through better access to emergency and local information but also go a long way in improving user experience and awareness about National Highways across the country, the statement said.(Edited by : Vivek Dubey)

title: India's only Mud Volcano erupts after 20-years in Andamans
content:
Minor volcanic eruptions were also noticed twice in a span of eight days at Barren Island in Andaman and Nicobar Islands on September 13 and 20.Dormant for more than two decades, India’s only mud volcano at Baratang in Andaman and Nicobar Islands has again erupted, an official said on Friday, October 3.

The volcano erupted with a deafening sound on October 2, the official said.

"The mud volcano here is formed by gases deep inside the earth from decaying organic matter. It pushes the mud and gas to the surface, which creates bubbles and craters. It is one of the must-visit spots in Andaman and Nicobar Islands," the official said.

"We received Information at around 1.30 pm on Thursday (October 2) about a violent eruption of a mud volcano at Jarwa Creek, Baratang. Such a big eruption was last reported in 2005. The eruption was followed by a deafening sound like an explosion. On receiving the information, local police officers, along with forest officials, visited the spot," a senior police officer said.

Baratang is located in the North and Middle Andaman district, and it is nearly 150 km away from Port Blair. It is a very popular tourist spot because it is India’s only mud volcano.

"As a result of the eruption, an earth mound of about 3-4 metres in height has formed, and the muddy soil has spread over an area of more than 1,000 sq metres. The eruption is still continuing, with mud and smoke continuously coming out. As a safety precaution, the movement of tourists towards the mud volcano has been stopped. The Forest department has closed the approach routes. The incident has also been reported to the Geological department," the officer said.

All safety measures have been taken for tourists and the local people, he said.

The police team has informed the Fiber Boat Owners’ Association and local tourist vehicle owners regarding the suspension of movement towards the mud volcano site.

Also Read: 'Opportunity will come soon': Army Chief warns Pakistan against terrorism, asks soldiers to be ready 

Recently, minor volcanic eruptions were also noticed twice in a span of eight days at Barren Island in Andaman and Nicobar Islands on September 13 and 20.

Nearly 140 km away from Port Blair by sea, this uninhabited Island lies at the junction of the Indian and Burmese tectonic plates. The total area of Barren Island is 8.34 square kilometres, and the nearest habitation is Swaraj Dweep (Havelock Island) and Narcondam Lookout Post (LoP), which is nearly 140-150 km respectively from Barren Island.

According to data available with Andaman and Nicobar administration’s archive, the first eruption at Barren Island took place in 1787 followed by mild eruptions in 1991, 2005, 2017 and the most recent one was in November 2022.

"The mud volcano at Baratang and active volcano in Barren Island are located at separate locations and both are not the same. The recent active volcanic eruption on September 13 and 20 was reported at Barren Island, but this one (mud volcano) was reported (on October 2) from mud volcano in Baratang," the official said.

title: Andhra CM to launch Auto Driverla Sevalo scheme, offering ₹15,000 to auto and cab drivers
content:
HomeIndia NewsAndhra CM to launch Auto Driverla Sevalo scheme, offering ₹15,000 to auto and cab driversAndhra Pradesh CM N. Chandrababu Naidu will launch the Auto Driverla Sevalo scheme on October 4, providing ₹15,000 annual financial support to 2.9 lakh auto, taxi and maxi cab drivers across the state.Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu will launch a new welfare programme titled 'Auto Driverla Sevalo' on October 4. The scheme will provide annual financial assistance of ₹15,000 to 2,90,234 autorickshaw, taxi and maxi cab drivers across the state. The launch will take place in the Vijayawada Central constituency.

The government has allocated about ₹435 crore for the scheme. The financial aid will be deposited directly into the bank accounts of eligible drivers.

Earlier, under the Vahana Mitra scheme, drivers received ₹12,000 per year. The new programme increases this amount, and both existing Vahana Mitra beneficiaries and new applicants will be included.

According to officials, the scheme was announced on September 12 and was initially planned for Dasara but was later rescheduled to October 4. It is intended to help drivers whose incomes have fallen since the government launched the Stree Shakti scheme, which has been providing free bus travel for women since August 15, Independence Day.

Eligibility is restricted to permanent residents of Andhra Pradesh who own and drive passenger vehicles such as autorickshaws, taxis or maxi cabs. Applicants must have a valid driving licence, Aadhaar card, ration card and vehicle registration certificate. Drivers operating rented vehicles are not eligible.

The government has released the beneficiary list on September 24. Drivers can check their eligibility online through the GSWS-NBM portal using their Aadhaar details or offline by visiting Gram Secretariats in rural areas and Ward Secretariats in urban areas.

Besides this initiative, the state government has also reduced green tax on older vehicles and invested in road development to support drivers. Naidu said the programme was not part of the NDA’s original manifesto but has been introduced to address the difficulties caused by Stree Shakti.

Speaking earlier in the Assembly, the Chief Minister said the NDA coalition, with support from Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Deputy Chief Minister K. Pawan Kalyan, is in a position to expand welfare schemes and increase financial aid compared to the previous government.

He added that the government is also working on lowering electricity charges, completing irrigation projects worth ₹2,000 crore in North Andhra, finishing six lakh houses by June 2026, and speeding up work on the Bhogapuram international airport, expected to open in August 2026.

In recent meetings, Naidu highlighted that the state is spending ₹2,745 crore every month on pensions, benefitting 63.5 lakh people, and has disbursed a total of ₹48,019 crore in pensions over the last 16 months. He also said the Stree Shakti scheme has enabled 8.86 crore free bus rides by women in 45 days, with the government spending ₹247 crore per month on it.

Naidu further noted that the state has attracted investments worth ₹10 lakh crore, creating nine lakh jobs, with 4.7 lakh people already employed in the last 15 months. He also promised to continue support for farmers under Annadata Sukheebhava, expand housing programmes, and promote women’s entrepreneurship through DWCRA groups.(Edited by : Vivek Dubey)

title: 'Opportunity will come soon': Army Chief warns Pakistan against terrorism, asks soldiers to be ready
content:
HomeIndia News'Opportunity will come soon': Army Chief warns Pakistan against terrorism, asks soldiers to be readyArmy Chief General Upendra Dwivedi also asked Indian troops to be prepared. "Keep yourselves fully prepared now, if god wants, the opportunity will come soon," he reportedly said.Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi issued a strong warning to Pakistan on Friday, October 3, urging the neighbouring country to stop supporting terrorism if it wants to “retain its place on the world map.”Addressing troops at Anupgarh in Rajasthan’s Sriganganagar district, General Dwivedi emphasised that India’s previous restraint during Operation Sindoor would not be repeated in any future conflict.
“India, as a country, is fully prepared this time. And this time, it will not show the restraint that it showed during Operation Sindoor 1.0. This time we will take a step forward and act in a manner that will make Pakistan think whether it wants to remain on the world map or not,” news agency PTI quoted the army chief as saying.
He also called on Indian soldiers to stay vigilant and ready. “Keep yourselves fully prepared now, if god wants, the opportunity will come soon,” PTI report added him as saying.
General Dwivedi further claimed that India had successfully exposed terrorist hideouts within Pakistan during its military operations, stating that without India’s intervention, these sites would have remained hidden from the global community.
The army chief clarified that India targeted nine terrorist camps inside Pakistan — seven by the Army and two by the Air Force.
“We had identified the targets because we only wanted to harm the terrorists. We had aimed to strike their bases. We have no complaints against ordinary Pakistani citizens, so long as their country does not sponsor terrorists. Because terrorists were being sponsored, those terrorist targets were hit,” he said, according to PTI.
He was referring to the May 7 strikes known as Operation Sindoor, which were launched in retaliation for the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack that claimed 26 Indian lives.
The operation reportedly eliminated over 100 terrorists before Pakistan sought a ceasefire on May 10.
Through Operation Sindoor, India had decimated nine terror camps through precision strikes in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) on May 7 and eliminated over 100 terrorists before Islamabad sought a ceasefire on May 10.
India also destroyed four to five F-16 fighter jets of Pakistan in Operation Sindoor, according to Indian Air Force Chief AP Singh. He said Pakistan also lost radars, command and control centres, runways and hangars.
Speaking at a press conference on Friday, Singh said that the air force has drawn Roadmap 2047 to enhance its combat capabilities, highlighting the need to look for newer aircraft and replace older ones.

title: CEC, ECs to visit Bihar, review poll preparedness on Oct 4-5
content:
HomeIndia NewsCEC, ECs to visit Bihar, review poll preparedness on Oct 4-5Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar and team visit Patna to review Bihar poll preparedness ahead of Assembly elections and voter list updates.Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar and Election Commissioners Vivek Joshi and S S Sandhu will visit Patna for two days beginning Saturday, October 04, to review poll preparedness in Bihar, officials said.

The term of the 243-member Bihar Assembly ends on November 22 and polls in the state are likely to be held in multiple phases beginning at the end of this month and in November.

It is common practice for the poll authority to visit states before announcing the election schedule.

The CEC and election commissioners will be in the state on October 4 and 5, the officials said on Friday.
The EC meets representatives of political parties and top police, administrative and state poll officials while reviewing election readiness.

A briefing of general, police and expenditure observers appointed by the Election Commission (EC) for the Bihar polls is underway here.

The Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the voters’ list in Bihar has concluded and the final electoral roll, published on September 30, has nearly 7.42 crore electors.

The SIR, conducted after a gap of over two decades, has come under sharp criticism from opposition parties who have claimed that it will disenfranchise crores of genuine citizens.

The EC has asserted that it will not allow any eligible citizen to be left out of the voters’ list and at the same time, no ineligible person will be on the list.

title: Karur stampede: Madras HC constitutes SIT; PIL petitioner alleges death threat from Vijay's TVK
content:
HomeIndia NewsKarur stampede: Madras HC constitutes SIT; PIL petitioner alleges death threat from Vijay's TVKAnother bench, hearing various petitions seeking that the probe in the Karur stampede be heard by the Central Bureau of India (CBI), noted that the investigation in the matter by the Tamil Nadu Police is still in the early stages and dismissed the pleas. Read on:(Photo Credit : Actor-turned politician Vijay's TVK rally in Tamil Nadu's Karur on  September 27 (Photo via News18) )The Madras High Court on Friday, October 3, ordered constituting a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe the stampede at actor-turned-politician Vijay's TVK rally in Karur on Sept 27. On the other hand, the petitioner who sought ban on roadshows alleged that he received a death threat from a TVK leader.

The court ordered the formation of the SIR under senior IPS officer Asra Garg who is currently the North Zone's Inspector General of Police, reported news agency PTI.

The stampede claimed lives of 41 people while leaving over 60 injured.

The bench of Justice N Sethilkumar was hearing the writ petition filed in the matter and questioned why Vijay was not named in the first information report (FIR) filed in the case.

Justice Sethilkumar also criticised the TVK leaders and observed that "they had abandoned the scene of occurrence" while failing to take moral or legal responsibility, as per News18.

"The court cannot close its eyes and shirk its responsibilities," the bench observed, adding that the TVK party did not even expressed remorse over the accident. "This shows the mental state of the leader," the bench added.

PIL petitioner alleges death threat from TVK 

The petitioner who filed a public interest litigation (PIL) before the Madras High Court, seeking a ban on the gatherings on roadshows, allegedly received a death threat from TVK district secretary Vinoth.

Amaravel Pandian, the petitioner’s advocate told reporters on Oct 3, that this happened after the court's hearing today.
"After today’s court hearing, a person named Vinoth, the TVK Secretary of Bhoothagudi, went directly to my client Kathiresan’s house and threatened him with death. As soon as Kathiresan contacted me, Vinoth and the others fled the scene," he said, as per PTI.

"We have now filed a fresh case before the Madurai Bench of the High Court, citing intimidation and threat to life," Pandian added.

The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court had issued an interim injunction banning the political parties from organising public events or meetings on state and national highways in Tamil Nadu till the time Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) are drafted in the matter, reported news agency ANI.

The order was passed while hearing four PILs which sought directions to frame SOPs for mass gatherings to prevent Karur-like accidents.

Noting that a similar case regarding SOPs is pending before the Principal Seat at Madras, the judges allowed the petitioners to be impleaded in that matter, as per ANI.

The government also reportedly assured the court that no meetings will be permitted, except at the earmarked places, until SOPs are finalised.

Pleas seeking SBI probe dismissed 

Another bench, hearing various petitions seeking that the probe in the Karur stampede be heard by the Central Bureau of India (CBI), noted that the investigation in the matter by the Tamil Nadu Police is still in the early stages and dismissed the pleas.

"If aggrieved persons come to this court, we will rescue. Who are you? Don’t treat this court as the political arena. If, in the investigation, something goes wrong, you come. This is the initial stage," the division bench of Justices M Dhandapani and M Jothiraman was quoted as saying by Bar and Bench.

The bench further directed the government and political parties to make sure that facilities of drinking water and sanitation are arranged properly at their rallies or meetings.

Tamil Nadu is expected to hold Assembly elections by the first half of 2026.

title: Global study projects 51 lakh in India could be at risk of chikungunya every year in long-term
content:
HomeIndia NewsGlobal study projects 51 lakh in India could be at risk of chikungunya every year in long-termAround the world, more than 1.40 crore people every year could be at risk of chikungunya infection in the long term, the study estimated.India could experience the biggest impacts of chikungunya in the long-term, potentially putting 51 lakh people at risk of the mosquito-borne infection every year, a global modelling study published in the British Medical Journal (BMJ) Global Health suggests.

Brazil and Indonesia might be the second and third most affected, with impacts due to the disease in India and Brazil accounting for 48% of the global impact on healthcare systems and individuals, the findings show.

The study, led by researchers at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, suggests chronic health impacts will be the biggest concern, with existing evidence suggesting around 50% of the affected possibly grappling with a long-term disability.

Around the world, more than 1.40 crore people every year could be at risk of chikungunya infection in the long term, the study estimated.

"The potential spread of vectors carrying viruses like chikungunya won’t wait for us to carry out years of research, so it’s been extremely important to us that the model we’re working on is shared and used in real time to help public health professionals manage current cases and prepare for the future," said co-author Sushant Sahastrabuddhe, associate director general of innovation, initiatives, and enterprise development at the International Vaccine Institute, South Korea.

Chikungunya is a virus that spreads through bites of the 'Aedes aegypti' and 'Aedes albopictus' mosquitoes, more commonly known as yellow fever and tiger mosquitoes. Symptoms can include high fever and severe joint pain, and about 50% of the patients are said to suffer from long-term joint pain and disability.

While there are no specific treatments for the viral mosquito-borne infection, two preventive vaccines have been approved for use in certain countries, including the US.

The study is the first of its kind to predict chikungunya burden by combining existing data on chikungunya infections with factors that may influence the likelihood of infections, the authors said.

Previous estimates that often looked at surveillance and outbreak reports could likely be an underestimate, they added.

Also Read: Rains likely in parts of UP, Bihar; showers predicted in Delhi-NCR

Estimates presented in the study could be useful for prioritising regions and targeting vulnerable age groups — children under 10, adults aged 80 and over — for introducing chikungunya vaccine, the team said.

They estimated "global chikungunya burden annually of 14.4 million (1.44 crore) infections" and "India and Brazil accounted for 48% of the global burden".

"The chronic phase accounts for 54% of chikungunya burden, with relatively higher burden among 40-60-year-old population, with mortality disproportionately affecting children under 10 and adults over 80,” the team added.

Lead researcher Hyolim Kang, also a research fellow at Nagasaki University, "It’s been widely thought that mosquitoes carrying chikungunya would be confined to subtropical or tropical continents, but our analysis has found that the risk extends way beyond these regions." "Prevention of the spread of this disease is important for everyone.

There are no specific antiviral therapies for chikungunya and treatment relies solely on supportive care. Not only are infections extremely painful, even the healthiest of people can be infected and left with life-long disability,” Kang said.

title: Mumbai metro line-3 train evacuated near Santacruz after technical snag
content:
HomeIndia NewsMumbai metro line-3 train evacuated near Santacruz after technical snagA Mumbai Metro Line-3 train was evacuated at Santacruz due to a technical issue. MMRCL ensured passenger safety, with other services running as scheduled on the Aqua Line.A Worli-bound underground metro train on the Mumbai Metro Line-3 was evacuated on Friday afternoon, October 03, after it developed a technical issue, the Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation Ltd (MMRCL) said.The train, moving towards Acharya Atre Chowk, encountered a snag while approaching Santacruz station around 2.44 pm. “As a precautionary measure, the train was safely evacuated at Santacruz station and later moved to the Bandra-Kurla Complex loopline for a detailed technical inspection,” the corporation said in a statement.
The affected service was cancelled, but all other metro services continued to run on schedule. “We regret the inconvenience caused to passengers and appreciate their cooperation. Passenger safety remains our highest priority, and necessary protocols were promptly followed,” MMRCL added.
Mumbai Metro Line-3, also called the Aqua Line, is the city’s first fully underground metro corridor. Of its 33.5 km stretch between Colaba, BKC and Aarey JVLR, the section from Acharya Atre Chowk to Aarey JVLR has been operational since May 2025. The BKC to Aarey JVLR stretch was earlier opened to commuters in October 2024.

title: PM Modi to unveil youth-focused initiatives worth over ₹62,000 crore on October 4
content:
These initiatives aim to boost education, skilling, and entrepreneurship across the country, with a special focus on Bihar.Prime Minister Narendra Modi will unveil youth-focused initiatives worth over ₹62,000 crore on October 4 at 11 am in Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi.

These initiatives aim to boost education, skilling, and entrepreneurship across the country, with a special focus on Bihar.

In accordance with the Prime Minister's vision, the program will also include the fourth edition of the National Skill Convocation, the Kaushal Deekshant Samaroh, where 46 All India Toppers from Industrial Training Institutes under the Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship will be felicitated.

Modi will launch PM-SETU (Pradhan Mantri Skilling and Employability Transformation through Upgraded ITIs), a centrally sponsored project worth ₹60,000 crore. The PM-SETU scheme involves upgrading 1,000 government ITIs across the country in a hub-and-spoke model, with 200 hub ITIs and 800 spoke ITIs.

“Collectively, PM-SETU will redefine India’s ITI ecosystem, making it government-owned but industry-managed, with global co-financing support from the World Bank and Asian Development Bank. In the first phase of the scheme implementation, there will be special focus on ITIs in Patna and Darbhanga,” the statement read.

Further, he will also launch 1,200 Vocational Skill Labs in 400 Navodaya Vidyalayas and 200 Eklavya Model Residential Schools across 34 states and union territories. These labs will provide hands-on training in 12 high-demand sectors, including IT, automotive, and logistics, and will train 1,200 vocational teachers to deliver industry-relevant learning.

The Prime Minister will launch initiatives in Bihar, including the Mukhyamantri Nishchay Svyam Sahayata Bhatta Yojana, providing ₹1,000 monthly allowance and skill training to 5 lakh graduate youth, and the Bihar Student Credit Card Scheme, offering interest-free education loans up to ₹4 lakh.

According to PMO, more than 3.92 lakh students have already received loans totalling more than ₹ 7,880 crore through the initiative. He will also inaugurate the Bihar Yuva Ayog, a statutory commission for youth aged between 18 and 45, to further improve youth empowerment in the state and channel and harness the energy of the state's youthful population.

He will also inaugurate the Jan Nayak Karpoori Thakur Skill University in Bihar, which is intended to provide industry-oriented courses and vocational education in order to develop a globally competitive workforce.

Under the PM-USHA (Pradhan Mantri Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyan), the Prime Minister will lay the groundwork for new academic and research facilities at four Bihar universities: Patna University, Bhupendra Narayan Mandal University in Madhepura, Jai Prakash Vishwavidyalaya in Chapra, and Nalanda Open University in Patna, to improve higher education opportunities.

These developments, totalling ₹160 crore, will assist over 27,000 students by providing contemporary academic infrastructure, innovative laboratories, dorms, and transdisciplinary learning.

In addition, he will dedicate NIT Patna's Bihta campus to the country. The Prime Minister will also present employment letters to nearly 4,000 freshly hired candidates in Bihar's government, as well as ₹ 450 crore in scholarships through Direct Benefit Transfer to 25 lakh Class 9 and 10 students under the Mukhyamantri Balak/Balika Scholarship Scheme.

The projects that will be introduced are intended to provide major opportunities for India's youth. “By integrating education, skill development, entrepreneurship, and improved infrastructure, they aim to support a solid foundation for the country’s progress. With a special focus on Bihar, the state is likely to develop as a centre for skilled manpower, contributing to growth both regionally and nationally,” the PMO said.(Edited by : Sudarsanan Mani)

title: India's elite NSG commandos conduct large-scale counter-terror exercise 'Gandiva'
content:
HomeIndia NewsIndia's elite NSG commandos conduct large-scale counter-terror exercise 'Gandiva'These drills include complex scenarios involving hostage rescues, bomb threats, armed intrusions, and chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear, and explosive (CBRNe) situations.India's premier counter-terrorism force, the National Security Guard (NSG), also known as the Black Cat Commandos, is currently carrying out a large-scale, nationwide counter-terrorism exercise. Dubbed Exercise Gandiva, this operation involves realistic drills designed to test and enhance the country’s crisis response capabilities.

The drills are being conducted across various regions and simulate a wide range of terrorist threats. These include complex scenarios involving hostage rescues, bomb threats, armed intrusions, and chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear, and explosive (CBRNe) situations. The goal is to rehearse modern tactics and refine operational responses.
The most significant phase of the exercise took place on the nights of October 3 and 4, when the NSG executed simultaneous, high-intensity counter-terror drills in Varanasi, Chittorgarh, Pune, and Jammu. These unprecedented operations, overseen by senior officials from the NSG and the Ministry of Home Affairs, showcased the force's ability to respond swiftly and effectively to coordinated attacks in multiple locations.

Key scenarios during Exercise Gandiva included:
 	Counter-terror and hostage rescue missions at public places, religious and sensitive locations, and river cruise vessels.
 	Detection and defusing of bomb and IED threats.
 	Neutralising armed intrusions at both public and private facilities.
 	Response protocols for CBRNe incidents.

Exercise Gandiva is part of the NSG’s annual training calendar and is conducted in coordination with State Police Forces, Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs), Airport and Waterways Authorities, and local administrations. The exercise not only tested rapid deployment capabilities but also highlighted seamless inter-agency coordination and the country's readiness to tackle evolving terrorist threats.

Through these drills, the NSG demonstrated how even the most challenging operations can be executed successfully with precise planning, coordination, and execution.

title: India slams Pakistan at UNHRC, says attempts to mislead forum exposes its hypocrisy
content:
HomeIndia NewsIndia slams Pakistan at UNHRC, says attempts to mislead forum exposes its hypocrisyCounsellor in the Permanent Mission of India, Geneva, KS Mohammed Hussain also said that India has been steadfastly making efforts to ensure the fullest enjoyment of human rights by our people and to realise sustainable development. Read on:India slammed Pakistan at the UN Human Rights Council, saying a country with one of the world’s worst human rights records should confront the rampant State-sponsored persecution and systemic discrimination of religious minorities in its own society.

“We find it deeply ironic that a country with one of the world’s worst human rights records seeks to lecture others,” Counsellor in the Permanent Mission of India, Geneva, KS Mohammed Hussain said while speaking during a General Debate at the 60th Session of Human Rights Council at Geneva.

“Their attempts to misuse this august forum with fabricated allegations against India only expose their hypocrisy. Instead of making baseless propaganda, they should confront the rampant State-sponsored persecution and systemic discrimination (of religious and ethnic minorities) that plague their own society,” Hussain said Tuesday (Sept 30) without mentioning any country.

But it was a clear reference to Pakistan, whose representative, speaking before India, raked up the Kashmir issue.

Read more: 4-5 Pakistan's F-16 fighter jets destroyed during Operation Sindoor, says Air Chief AP Singh

India has repeatedly told Pakistan that Jammu and Kashmir “was, is and shall forever” remain an integral part of the country.

Hussain also said India has been steadfastly making efforts to ensure the fullest enjoyment of human rights by our people and to realise sustainable development. We must collectively reaffirm our commitment to the ideals of the VDPA.

VDPA, or the Vienna Declaration and Programme of Action, adopted after the World Conference on Human Rights of 1993, is a milestone document that has strengthened the foundation laid by the Universal Declaration of Human Rights for the promotion and protection of human rights.

title: Assam alone reported 90% child marriage cases in 2023, reveals NCRB data
content:
HomeIndia NewsAssam alone reported 90% child marriage cases in 2023, reveals NCRB dataStates and union territories that reported no cases under the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act in 2023 are Chhattisgarh, Nagaland, Ladakh, and Lakshadweep.The year 2023 saw a sixfold jump in cases registered under the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act as compared to 2022. Assam alone accounted for nearly 90% of the total cases, the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) data revealed.

Under the act, 6,038 cases were filed in 2023, a sharp rise from 1,002 cases in 2022 and 1,050 in 2021. The data stated that 16,737 girls and 129 boys were kidnapped or abducted "for marriage" in 2023.

Assam reported the highest number of cases at 5,267, followed by Tamil Nadu (174), Karnataka (145), and West Bengal (118).

States and union territories that reported no cases under the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act in 2023 are Chhattisgarh, Nagaland, Ladakh, and Lakshadweep.

The Act, enacted in 2006, prohibits marriage of girls below the age of 18 and boys below 21, and criminalises those who organise, perform or facilitate such marriages.

title: Cough syrup killing kids: Probe committees formed as toll rises in Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan
content:
HomeIndia NewsHealthcare NewsCough syrup killing kids: Probe committees formed as toll rises in Madhya Pradesh, RajasthanAt least nine children died in Chhindwara region in Madhya Pradesh due to alleged intake of medicines which reportedly led to kidney failure.Committees have been formed in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan to probe the deaths of children who allegedly died due to consumption of tainted cough syrup and medicines in the last 15 days.

At least nine children died in Chhindwara region in Madhya Pradesh due to the alleged intake of such medicines which reportedly led to their kidney failure, as per News18.

Rajasthan also witnessed deaths of at least three children in a similar instance of cough-syrup ingestion. Two children were reported dead in Sikar region while one passed away in Bharatpur.

Investigation committees of National Centre For Disease Control and state Drug Controllers have been formed following the deaths in MP and Rajasthan, with reports expected to be submitted on the cause of the deaths.

The National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) stated on Oct 1 that water samples and entomological samples were collected by the central agency for testing the alleged contamination in the syrups. The samples were taken from hospitals and other sites from both the states.

Actions taken by the MP govt 

While the district administration in MP banned two cough syrups, Coldrif and Nextro-DS, after the incidents came into light, the state's health minister indicated that preliminary findings do not indicate contamination.

"These deaths did not occur due to the cough syrup for sure," MP Health Minister Rajendra Shukla said on Wednesday, Oct 1, before the sample report, as per News18. "The matter of the cough syrup is baseless, and these deaths did not occur due to the cough syrup for sure."

He added that the report by Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) was awaited.

Meanwhile, the Drug and Pharmaceuticals Department, on Oct 3, raided Kataria Pharmaceuticals distributor in MP's Jabalpur, as per news agency PTI.
Drug Inspector, Sharad Kumar Jain said that as per the probe, Kataria Pharmaceuticals had ordered 660 bottles of Coldrif cough syrup from a company in Chennai.

"Out of these, 594 bottles were supplied in Chhindwara. The remaining 66 bottles were refrigerated, and 16 bottles were sent for lab testing at Bhopal Lab," Jain told PTI.

Rajpal Kataria, the distributor of Kataria Pharmaceuticals, said that more than 30 children fell sick after the syrup's consumption. "We had supplied the cough syrup in Chhindwara. More than 30 children fell ill after consuming it. After falling ill, the children were referred to hospitals in Nagpur. Six children died."

"The supply was made to New Apna Agency, Ayush Pharma, and Jain Medical and General Stores in Chhindwara. The Coldrif cough syrup was sourced from a company in Chennai," he added, as per PTI.

Rajasthan govt's actions on the matter 

The Rajasthan government also formed a committee to probe the matter whose findings are expected to come out in the next couple of days. Rajasthan Drug Controller Ajay Pathak said that the department received complaints of children falling ill after consumption of Dexamethasone syrup.

"Our drug inspector took the samples of the syrup from Sikar and Bharatpur. A report on the collected samples will come within the next three days. This syrup should not be given to children below five years of age," told ANI on Oct 1.

However, the health department clarified that the deaths were not related to contaminated cough syrups, in a statement released on Oct 2.

Dextromethorphan (DXM) drug is not prescribed to children, as per the protocols, stated Public Health Director Ravi Prakash Sharma in the statement, adding that in both the cases, the children were administered the syrup at home without a doctor's advice.

Tamil Nadu govt banned Coldrif 

The Tamil Nadu government also banned the sale of Coldrif cough syrup on Oct 3, News18 reported citing sources from the Tamil Nadu Department of Drugs.

The state's drug authority is reportedly carrying out an investigation into the matter.(Edited by : Prashanth Perumal)First Published: Oct 3, 2025 2:43 PM IST

title: Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) fines Drishti IAS ₹5 lakh for misleading UPSC 2022 result ads
content:
HomeIndia NewsCentral Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) fines Drishti IAS ₹5 lakh for misleading UPSC 2022 result adsDrishti IAS, in its advertisement, prominently claimed "216+ selections in UPSC CSE 2022" along with names and photographs of successful candidates. CCPA found that the claim was misleading and concealed crucial information regarding the type and duration of courses opted for by these candidates.The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has imposed a penalty of ₹5 lakhs on Drishti IAS (VDK Eduventures Pvt. Ltd.) for publishing misleading advertisements over the results of the UPSC Civil Services Examination (CSE) 2022.

Drishti IAS, in its advertisement, prominently claimed "216+ selections in UPSC CSE 2022" along with names and photographs of successful candidates. However, upon examination, CCPA found that the claim was misleading and concealed crucial information regarding the type and duration of courses opted for by these candidates.

The investigation revealed that out of the 216 candidates claimed by Drishti IAS, as many as 162 candidates (75%) had only taken the free Interview Guidance Programme (IGP) of the Institute, after independently clearing the Preliminary and Mains stages of UPSC CSE. Only 54 students were enrolled in IGP+ and other courses.

The authorities stated that Drishti IAS deliberately concealed important information, misleading aspirants and parents into believing the institute was responsible for their success in all stages of the UPSC examination. This act qualifies as a misleading advertisement under Section 2(28) of the Consumer Protection Act, 2019.

CCPA noted that this is the second penalty imposed on Drishti IAS for similar conduct. Earlier, in September 2024, the Authority had passed a final order against the institute for its misleading claim of "150+ selections in UPSC CSE 2021". The institute submitted the details of 161 candidates against its claim of 150+ selections in UPSC CSE 2021. Therein, as well, out of the total candidates, 148 were enrolled in IGP, seven were enrolled in the Mains Mentorship Program, four were enrolled in the GS Foundation Program, and one was enrolled in an Optional course. The details of the remaining candidate were not mentioned. CCPA imposed a penalty of ₹ 3 lakh and directed to discontinue the misleading advertisement.

The order noted that despite being penalised and cautioned earlier, Drishti IAS once again indulged in the same practice for the 2022 examination results by enhancing its claim to "216+ selections". It added that the concealment of such crucial information deprived prospective students and parents of their right to make an informed choice under Section 2(9) of the Consumer Protection Act, 2019, indicating that such advertisements create false expectations and unfairly influence consumer decisions, particularly when large claims are made without transparent disclosure of facts.

So far, the CCPA has issued 54 notices to various coaching institutes for misleading advertisements and unfair trade practices. Penalties amounting to over ₹ 90.6 lakh have been imposed on 26 coaching institutes, along with directions to discontinue such misleading claims. CCPA noted that all such institutes concealed important information regarding courses opted by successful candidates in their advertisement, which amounts to misleading advertisement under the Consumer Protection Act, 2019.

The Authority has emphasised that all coaching institutes must strictly ensure truthful disclosure of information in their advertisements so that students can make fair and informed decisions regarding their academic choices.

title: 2025 Mahindra Thar facelift launched at ₹10 lakh with new features, trims, colours
content:
HomeAuto News2025 Mahindra Thar facelift launched at ₹10 lakh with new features, trims, coloursThe facelift does not bring any new engine options or a soft-top variant. Under GST 2.0, Mahindra had reduced the price of the previous Thar by up to ₹1.35 lakh and offered an additional ₹20,000 benefit, which is not applicable for the new model.Mahindra & Mahindra, on Friday,  launched the 2025 Mahindra Thar facelift (3-door) in India. Prices start at ₹9.99 lakh and go up to ₹16.99 lakh (ex-showroom).

The previous model was priced between ₹10.32 lakh and ₹16.61 lakh. The entry-level facelift is ₹32,000 cheaper, while the top LXT 4WD AT variant costs ₹38,000 more than before.

The facelift is offered in two trims: AXT and LXT. Both trims are available with rear-wheel drive (RWD) and four-wheel drive (4WD) configurations. Variant-wise prices (ex-showroom) are:Variant

Price (Ex-Showroom)
1.5 diesel AXT RWD MT₹9.99 lakh1.5 diesel LXT RWD MT₹12.19 lakh2.2 diesel LXT 4WD MT₹15.49 lakh2.2 diesel LXT 4WD AT₹16.99 lakh2.0 petrol LXT RWD AT₹13.99 lakh2.0 petrol LXT 4WD MT₹14.69 lakh2.0 petrol LXT 4WD AT₹16.25 lakh
The Thar facelift retains the same three engines as before: a 117hp 1.5-litre diesel, a 130hp 2.2-litre diesel, and a 150hp 2.0-litre turbo-petrol. Peak torque is 300Nm for the diesel engines and 300Nm with manual or 320Nm with automatic for the petrol.

Transmission options include a 6-speed manual and a 6-speed automatic torque converter, with AT variants now featuring a dead pedal.
4WD models get an electric driveline disconnect on the front axle, while RWD variants have an electronic brake locking differential. Off-road specifications remain unchanged: 41.8° approach angle, 36° departure angle, 27° ramp-over angle, and 650mm water wading depth. Hill hold, hill descent control, and electronic stability program with rollover mitigation are standard.

Exterior updates include a tweaked grille, a dual-tone front bumper, and two new colours: Battleship Grey and Tango Red. Other available colours are Galaxy Grey, Stealth Black, Deep Forest, and Everest White.

The round headlamps with LED DRLs remain. LXT variants add 18-inch alloy wheels, dual-tone bumpers, fog lamps with DRLs, side foot steps, and a rear wiper with a washer. The fuel lid can now be opened from inside.

The interior features a redesigned dashboard, new steering wheel, rear AC vents, sliding armrest console, door-mounted power window switches, and an A-pillar grab handle. The SUV now comes with a 10.25-inch HD touchscreen with Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, Adventure Statistics Gen II, cruise control, rear view camera, Tyretronics TPMS with tyre direction monitoring, and a rear demister.

The AXT trim includes round headlamps, LED taillamps, 16-inch steel wheels, vinyl seats, a height-adjustable driver seat, remote keyless entry, and safety features like dual airbags, ABS with EBD and brake assist, rear parking sensors, and a built-in roll cage.

The LXT trim adds 18-inch alloy wheels, dual-tone bumpers, fabric seats, front fog lamps, electric ORVMs, a rear wiper, cruise control, four speakers with two tweeters, a rear camera, and a dead pedal in automatic variants.

The facelift does not bring any new engine options or a soft-top variant. The updates focus on features, comfort, and convenience. Under GST 2.0, Mahindra had reduced the price of the previous Thar by up to ₹1.35 lakh and offered an additional ₹20,000 benefit, which is not applicable for the new model.

title: 4-5 Pakistan's F-16 fighter jets destroyed during Operation Sindoor, says Air Chief AP Singh
content:
HomeIndia News4-5 Pakistan's F-16 fighter jets destroyed during Operation Sindoor, says Air Chief AP SinghHe said Operation Sindoor was a reflection of tri-services synergy and the world can learn lesson from India on conflict termination.Indian Air Force Chief AP Singh on Friday said four to five F-16 fighter jets of Pakistan were likely destroyed during Operation Sindoor. He said Pakistan's losses included radars, command and control centres, runways and hangars.

The Air Chief said, "As far as Pakistan's losses are concerned, we have struck a large number of their airfields and we struck a large number of installations. Because of these strikes, radars at least four places, command and control centres at two places, runways of course damaged at two places, then three of their hangars in three different stations have been damaged. We have signs of one C-130 class of aircraft and at least 4 to 5 fighter aircraft. Along with that, one SAM system has been destroyed."

On Pakistan's claim of downing 15 Indian fighter jets, the Air Chief said, "If they (Pak) say 15 of our aircraft were downed, let them believe it… I won’t comment."

He said Operation Sindoor was a reflection of tri-services synergy and the world can learn a lesson from India on conflict termination.

India launched Operation Sindoor on May 7, targeting terrorist infrastructure in territories controlled by Pakistan in response to the Pahalgam terror attack. The strikes triggered four days of intense clashes which ended with an understanding over stopping the military actions on May 10.

At a press conference ahead of the Air Force Day, the Air Chief Marshal also said his force has drawn up a Roadmap 2047 to enhance its combat capabilities. He added that there is a need to look for newer aircraft and replace older ones.

"We need almost two squadrons worth being produced in a year to remain at a number that is comfortable. That means nearly 30 to 40 aircraft per year," he said.First Published: Oct 3, 2025 1:23 PM IST

title: Snow leopard population in Himachal rises 62% in 4 years, hits record 83 count
content:
HomeIndia NewsSnow leopard population in Himachal rises 62% in 4 years, hits record 83 countThe snow leopard population in Himachal Pradesh has surged by 62% in four years, reaching 83, as per a new survey that highlights strong community involvement and expanding habitats.The population of rare snow leopards in high-altitude tribal areas of Himachal Pradesh has increased by 62 per cent over the past four years, says a newly released survey.

The count stood at 51 in 2021, according to the baseline survey conducted by the Wildlife Wing of the state Forest Department. It has now increased to 83, officials said on Friday, citing the study conducted during the past year.

The survey also involved strong community participation, indicating that the long-term conservation plans with community involvement are bearing results, they added.

The new survey released on Thursday (the first day of the Wildlife Week being observed from October 2 to 8) said the count excluded cubs and exceeded the estimated upper confidence limit of 73 over the 2021 survey, reflecting possible expansion of habitats.
The survey was conducted through a large-scale camera trapping exercise across six sites over an area of 26,000 sq km. The snow leopards and their habitats were detected in the tribal areas of Lahaul-Spiti, Kinnaur and the Pangi valley.

However, the study also recorded their presence beyond the protected areas, which comprise the Kibber Wildlife Sanctuary, Great Himalayan National Park, Sechu Tuan Nallah Wildlife Sanctuary and Asrang Wildlife Sanctuary.

In addition to snow leopards, the survey also drew distribution maps for key prey species such as the blue sheep, Himalayan ibex and musk deer, as well as other high-altitude mammals such as Himalayan wolves, brown bears, leopards, red foxes, and martens.

Notably, the study reported the first official sighting of Pallas's cat in Kinnaur and the rediscovery of the woolly flying squirrel in Lahaul, highlighting the rich biodiversity of the state.

According to the officials, community involvement was key to the survey's success. Local youths and women from Kibber village in Spiti assisted with camera trap deployments and data analysis, while frontline forest officers and other community members supported field operations. The survey was completed in one year compared to the three-year timeline in 2021, they said.

The survey was cost-effective and prepared a scalable framework for long-term snow leopard monitoring in India. Himachal Pradesh is now the first state in the country to conduct a second statewide snow leopard assessment, they added.(Edited by : Vivek Dubey)

title: Maruti Suzuki cars cross world’s highest rail bridge to reach Anantnag in first batch
content:
HomeAuto NewsMaruti Suzuki cars cross world’s highest rail bridge to reach Anantnag in first batchMaruti Suzuki has become the first automaker in India to deliver vehicles to the Kashmir Valley by rail, sending over 100 cars from its Manesar plant to the newly opened Anantnag terminal.Maruti Suzuki India Limited has dispatched its first lot of vehicles to the Kashmir Valley by rail, marking a first for the country's automobile manufacturers in utilising Indian Railways for deliveries to the region.

The maiden train carried over 100 vehicles, including Brezza, Dzire, WagonR, and S-Presso. It departed from the newly inaugurated in-plant railway siding at Maruti Suzuki’s Manesar facility and covered more than 850 kilometres to reach the Anantnag railway terminal in Jammu & Kashmir.

On the way, the train crossed the Chenab river on the world’s highest railway arch bridge, inaugurated earlier this year under the Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla Rail Link project.

Union Minister for Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw said, “In recent times, apples from the valley have been transported using the Jammu & Kashmir rail link. Now, Maruti Suzuki cars will be transported to Kashmir valley by rail. Jammu – Srinagar railway line is a game changer for the people of Jammu & Kashmir.” Flag off of the first batch of over 100 Maruti Suzuki vehicles sent via rail for Anantnag from Manesar in-plant railway siding.

Maruti Suzuki’s Managing Director & CEO, Hisashi Takeuchi, said, “Railway dispatches are central to our logistics strategy. The world’s highest railway arch bridge over Chenab river is one such landmark, enabling seamless and efficient connectivity to Kashmir valley and allowing Maruti Suzuki to better serve customers in the region.”

He added that the company operates in-plant railway sidings at both Manesar and Gujarat under the PM GatiShakti National Master Plan, enabling direct dispatches from its production facilities.

The announcement coincides with a surge in demand during the festive season. Maruti Suzuki delivered 1.65 lakh vehicles in the first eight days of Navratri and expects the figure to cross 2 lakh by the end of the nine-day festival. The company reported 3.5 lakh bookings during this period, with nearly 2.5 lakh still pending.

Partho Banerjee, Senior Executive Officer, Marketing & Sales, said, “It is all because of the initiative taken by our Honourable Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi ji on GST rate cut that the industry is witnessing strong growth.”

In September 2025, Maruti Suzuki’s domestic sales fell 8.3 percent year-on-year to 1,35,711 units, down from 1,48,061 in September 2024. However, exports hit a record 42,204 units, a 52.2 percent increase from last year, taking total sales to 1,89,665 units, up 2.7 percent year-on-year. The company has crossed 2.1 lakh units in exports in the first half of the financial year.

Segment-wise, compact cars recorded growth with 66,882 units sold compared to 60,480 in September 2024. Utility vehicles declined to 48,695 units from 61,549 despite demand for Brezza, Ertiga, Fronx, Grand Vitara, and the newly launched Victoris, mainly due to competition.

title: Afghan foreign minister Muttaqi set to visit India next week
content:
HomeIndia NewsAfghan foreign minister Muttaqi set to visit India next weekIndia has not yet recognised the Taliban set up and has been pitching for the formation of a truly inclusive government in Kabul. New Delhi has also been insisting that Afghan soil must not be used for any terrorist activities against any country. Read on:Afghan foreign minister Amir Khan Muttaqi is expected to visit India next week, in the first high-level trip from Kabul after Taliban captured power overthrowing the Ashraf Ghani government around four years ago.

The Afghan foreign minister is expected to visit India from October 10, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday (Oct 2). However, there is no official word on the visit yet.

Muttaqi was scheduled to visit New Delhi last month but it was called off in view of a travel ban that he faced under United Nations Security Council (UNSC) sanctions.

On September 30, a UNSC committee approved a temporary exemption to the travel ban, allowing Muttaqi to visit New Delhi from October 9 to 16, according to a UN statement.

Afghan media reported that Muttaqi will travel to Moscow on October 6 to attend the seventh round of Moscow Format talks.

Read more: Bareilly violence: Internet suspended, security heightened ahead of Friday prayers amid 'I Love Muhammad' row
The UNSC has slapped sanctions against all leading Taliban leaders and they have to secure a waiver for foreign travels.

Muttaqi's visit is expected to add a new dimension to India's relations with the Taliban set up in Kabul.

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar had held a phone conversation with Muttaqi on May 15. It was the highest level of contact between New Delhi and Kabul since the Taliban came to power.

India has not yet recognised the Taliban set up and has been pitching for the formation of a truly inclusive government in Kabul. New Delhi has also been insisting that Afghan soil must not be used for any terrorist activities against any country.

In January, the Taliban regime described India as an "important" regional and economic power following talks between Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri and Muttaqi.

India has so far sent several shipments of humanitarian aid, including wheat and medicines, to Afghanistan. India has been pitching to provide unimpeded aid to Afghanistan to address the unfolding humanitarian situation in the country.

In June 2022, India re-established its diplomatic presence in Kabul by deploying a "technical team" in its embassy in the Afghan capital.

India had withdrawn its officials from the embassy on concerns over security after the Taliban seized power in August 2021.

title: Bareilly violence: Internet suspended, security heightened ahead of Friday prayers amid 'I Love Muhammad' row
content:
HomeIndia NewsBareilly violence: Internet suspended, security heightened ahead of Friday prayers amid 'I Love Muhammad' rowSenior-most cleric of Ala Hazrat Dargah area Maulana Ahsan Razan Khan, appealed to all the Muslim locals to return to their homes after Friday prayers today to "maintain peace". Read on:The government ordered the shutdown of internet services in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly while the senior-most Muslim cleric asked the community's locals to return home after the Friday (October 3) prayers amid the ongoing "I Love Muhammad" controversy in the region.

The security has also been increased with heavy police deployment as the protests mark a week today.

The government suspended mobile internet, broadband, and SMS services from 3 pm on October 2 till 3 pm on October 4, according to department of home affair's notification, reported news agency PTI.

Home Secretary Gaurav Dayal stated that social media platforms such as WhatsApp, YouTube, and Facebook among others, could be misused to incite communal violence and spread rumours.

All the services including mobile internet, SMS, data servers including broadband connections will remain suspended, as per the order.

'Go home peacefully,' urges Muslim cleric 

Senior-most cleric of Ala Hazrat Dargah area Maulana Ahsan Razan Khan, appealed to all the Muslim locals to return to their homes after Friday prayers today to "maintain peace".

"Every Muslim, after offering Friday prayers, must return to their homes. Do not pay heed to rumours. Maintain peace," Khan was quoted as saying by PTI.

The appeal was issued on Thursday, October 2, to prevent any more violence in the city.

On September 26, violence had broken out when about 2,000 people has assembled outside a mosque in the Kotwali area to protest against the suspension of the proposed "I Love Muhammad" protests called by Tauqeer Raza Khan.

Stone-pelting was reported, and police resorted to lathi-charge.

At least 81 people have been arrested in the matter as of Wednesday, October 1, according to the news agency.

Congress, SP leaders on house-arrest

Congress MP Imran Masood and Samajwadi Party MLA Shahnavaz Khan were prevented by the police from visiting Bareilly on October 1.

A police team guarded their houses since the night of September 30, and no official statements were made to explain the reason for the action.

Masood addressed the reporters at his residence and said, "We follow the Gandhian ideology. We were to leave at 6:50 am for Bareilly to meet the DIG and ADG and return by 1:30 pm. But the government is using such tactics to hide its failures."

"It is the government and the police who have made the situation abnormal. Muslims are being selectively targeted. One set of laws applies to us, another to others," he added, while responding to a question whether their visit could have made the situation worse, as per PTI.

'I Love Mohammad' protests in UP

The controversy came to light on September 9, when Kanpur Police filed an FIR against 24 individuals for allegedly installing boards inscribed with 'I Love Mohammad,' on a public road on September 4 during a Barawafat procession, as reported by PTI. The FIR named nine people, while 15 were unidentified.

The move had triggered objections from Hindu organisations, alleging a "new trend" towards deliberately provoking emotions. The matter gained momentum after AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi started to assert that it was not a crime to say 'I Love Mohammad.'First Published: Oct 3, 2025 11:50 AM IST

title: Rains likely in parts of UP, Bihar; showers predicted in Delhi-NCR
content:
While Bihar prepares for significant rainfall, Mumbai experienced a brief break in the downpour. IMD has issued alerts for West Bengal, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, and Assam.Mumbai residents woke up to a bright and sunny sky following several days of heavy rain, yet the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light to moderate rain with winds of 30 to 40 km/h in certain areas across the region.

In addition, IMD has issued alerts for West Bengal, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Odisha and Assam. Other states are on orange alert, while Bihar has some areas under red alert.

Heavy rainfall is likely over Northwest India from October 5 to 7, with peak intensity on October 6, the IMD said. Heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely over eastern UP, Bihar, and Sikkim today and tomorrow, it added

Mumbai and Maharashtra 

The city woke up to a respite from the previous downpours as the intensity of the rain decreased overnight. Nonetheless, IMD predicts isolated areas across the region to experience light to moderate rains and gusty winds of 30 to 40 km/h. With watch warnings in effect for Aurangabad, Raigad, Pune, Satara, Ratnagiri, Kolhapur, Sindhudurg, Yavatmal, Wardha, and Chandrapur, Mumbai is primarily in green.
Thunderstorm accompanied with lightning, light to moderate rain with gusty winds 30-40 kmph very likely to occur at isolated places in the districts of Marathwada.
